applications.desc: Quickly frame research as fundable project: significance, innovation, approach overview, feasibility, broader impacts for grant concept paper.

applications.title: Specific Aims Page
applications.desc: Draft compelling specific aims: problem importance, knowledge gap, hypothesis/objectives, approach summary, expected outcomes in 1 page.

prompts.label: Grant concept
prompts.text: Help me frame [RESEARCH] as a grant proposal. Draft: significance (why important), innovation (what's new), approach (how), broader impacts (who benefits).

applications.title: OER Module Development

applications.title: Textbook Alternative Design
applications.desc: Curate and create free resources to replace expensive textbook: open textbooks, articles, videos, interactive content.

applications.title: Open Pedagogy Projects
applications.desc: Design assignments where students create openly-licensed resources for future students or public audiences.

prompts.label: OER module outline
prompts.text: Design an OER module on [TOPIC]. Include: learning objectives, curated open resources, original activities, assessment, appropriate CC license.

applications.title: HyFlex Course Design
applications.desc: Design course allowing students to attend in-person, synchronously online, or asynchronously while maintaining equivalent learning.

applications.title: Hybrid Session Planning
applications.desc: Strategically determine what happens online vs. in-person: concepts online, application in-person; individual online, collaborative in-person.

applications.title: Hybrid Assessment Equity
applications.desc: Create assessments that work equally well for all participation modes without disadvantaging any modality.

prompts.label: Hybrid session design
prompts.text: Design a hybrid lesson on [TOPIC]. Specify: what students do before class (online), what happens in-person, options for remote synchronous learners, asynchronous alternatives.

applications.title: Seminar Discussion Protocol
applications.desc: Design student-led seminar discussion: reading analysis framework, discussion roles (facilitator, note-taker), participation guidelines.

applications.title: Inquiry-Based Seminar
applications.desc: Create question-driven seminars where students generate questions, explore together, build collective understanding.

prompts.label: Seminar protocol
prompts.text: Design a student-led seminar protocol for discussing [READING]. Include: pre-class prep, opening activity, discussion structure, roles, closure synthesis.

applications.title: Differentiated Instruction
applications.desc: Design tiered activities or assignments where all students work toward same goals through different entry points and challenge levels.

applications.title: Flexible Grouping Strategies
applications.desc: Create group work that leverages diverse skills: peer teaching, complementary strengths, rotating expertise roles.

applications.title: Leveled Support Materials
applications.desc: Provide resources at multiple levels: basic guides, intermediate scaffolds, advanced extensions so students can self-select support needed.

prompts.label: Tiered activity
prompts.text: Create a tiered activity on [TOPIC] for mixed-level class. All tiers address same learning goal but differ in: complexity, support, independence required.

applications.title: Collaboration Network Mapping
applications.desc: Identify potential interdisciplinary collaborators: complementary expertise, shared interests, institutional connections, funding synergies.

applications.title: Team Science Planning
applications.desc: Design collaborative research structure: roles, workflows, authorship agreements, communication norms, conflict resolution.

applications.title: Partnership Development
applications.desc: Plan community-academic partnerships: mutual goals, equitable roles, knowledge exchange, sustainability, evaluation.

prompts.label: Collaboration plan
prompts.text: I'm interested in collaborating on [TOPIC] with [DISCIPLINE/COMMUNITY]. Help me: identify potential partners, articulate mutual benefits, draft outreach message, plan structure.

applications.title: SoTL Question Generation
applications.desc: Transform teaching observations into researchable questions about student learning: what works, what is, what could be questions.

applications.title: Classroom Research Design
applications.desc: Design manageable SoTL study: focused question, ethical data collection, simple analysis, dissemination plan for teaching conference.

applications.title: Action Research Cycle
applications.desc: Plan iterative improvement: try intervention, collect evidence, reflect, refine, repeat with systematic documentation.

prompts.label: SoTL question
prompts.text: I noticed [TEACHING OBSERVATION] in my class. Help me turn this into a SoTL research question and design a simple study to investigate it.

applications.title: Capstone Project Design
applications.desc: Create culminating project requiring integration across course or program: research, creation, application, reflection components.

applications.title: Advanced Application Tasks
applications.desc: Design assignments requiring upper-division skills: evaluating competing theories, designing studies, proposing solutions to complex problems.

applications.title: Pre-Professional Projects
applications.desc: Create assignments mirroring professional practice: case analyses, policy briefs, consulting reports, portfolio development.

prompts.label: Capstone project
prompts.text: Design a capstone project for upper-division course on [TOPIC]. Should: integrate multiple concepts, require original application, include research/creation component, culminate in professional-quality deliverable.

applications.title: Multi-Year Assessment Cycle
applications.desc: Design rotating assessment schedule: which outcomes assessed when, methods, responsibility, reporting timeline, use of results.

applications.title: Direct Measure Development
applications.desc: Create performance-based assessments of program outcomes: embedded course assignments, capstone projects, comprehensive exams with rubrics.

applications.title: Indirect Measure Design
applications.desc: Develop surveys, focus groups, exit interviews, employer feedback to complement direct measures with stakeholder perspectives.

prompts.text: Create a 5-year assessment plan for [PROGRAM] with [N] outcomes. For each year: which outcomes assessed, methods (direct/indirect), timeline, responsible parties, reporting format.

applications.title: Self-Study Report Writing
applications.desc: Organize evidence and draft narrative for accreditation standards: program mission, outcomes, curriculum, assessment, resources, improvement.

applications.title: Evidence Repository Organization
applications.desc: Catalog and organize documentation: syllabi, assessments, student work, improvement plans, meeting minutes aligned to standards.

applications.title: Continuous Improvement Documentation
applications.desc: Create narrative showing assessment  improvement cycle: findings, actions taken, evidence of impact, next steps.

prompts.text: Draft narrative for accreditation standard: [STANDARD]. Include: how we meet it, evidence to support, strengths, areas for improvement, action plan.

applications.title: Confidence-Building Activities
applications.desc: Design low-stakes activities that build first-year student confidence through success: structured collaboration, clear guidelines, immediate feedback.

applications.title: Study Skills Integration
applications.desc: Embed academic success strategies in content activities: note-taking practice, reading strategies, test prep, time management.

prompts.label: First-year activity
prompts.text: Create a class activity on [TOPIC] for first-year students that: is achievable in 20 minutes, has clear success criteria, builds confidence, teaches content + skills.

applications.title: Conference Abstract Writing
applications.desc: Draft compelling abstracts within word limits: hook, gap, contribution, method, key finding, significance for various conference formats.

applications.title: Poster Design Planning
applications.desc: Organize research for poster presentation: visual hierarchy, key takeaways, figure selection, QR code resources, elevator pitch.

applications.title: Lightning Talk Script
applications.desc: Distill research to 5-minute talk: one clear message, compelling narrative, memorable visuals, call to action or next steps.

prompts.label: Conference abstract
prompts.text: Write a [WORD LIMIT] abstract for [RESEARCH] for [CONFERENCE TYPE]. Include: compelling opening, gap/significance, approach, key finding, takeaway. Hook the reviewers.

applications.title: Research-to-Teaching Translation
applications.desc: Transform your research into teachable modules: identify accessible entry points, design scaffolded activities, create assessment connecting to research process.

applications.title: Research-Integrated Course
applications.desc: Build entire course around your research area: students engage with your methods, analyze related data, contribute to field understanding.

applications.title: Undergraduate Research Mentoring
applications.desc: Design tiered research opportunities: course-based research, independent studies, thesis projects aligned with your research program.

prompts.text: I research [TOPIC]. Design a 2-week module for [AUDIENCE] that: introduces key concepts from my research, uses authentic data/methods, scaffolds understanding, assesses learning.

applications.title: Dual-Purpose Content Creation
applications.desc: Write materials serving both teaching and research dissemination: literature reviews become course readings, methods become teaching cases.

applications.title: Publication Pipeline from Teaching
applications.desc: Design course projects that feed research: student data collection, content analysis, crowd-sourced examples that advance scholarship.

applications.title: Collaborative Knowledge Building
applications.desc: Create assignments where students contribute to knowledge base: Wikipedia editing, open database building, public scholarship.

prompts.label: Dual-purpose planning
prompts.text: I'm working on [RESEARCH/WRITING]. How can I: (1) use parts in my [COURSE], (2) have students contribute to the project, (3) turn teaching into publishable work?
